IRS990.MissionDescription: AUGUSTANA COLLEGE, ROOTED IN THE LIBERAL ARTS AND SCIENCES AND A LUTHERAN EXPRESSION OF THE CHRISTIAN FAITH, IS COMMITTED TO OFFERING A CHALLENGING EDUCATION THAT DEVELOPES QUALITIES OF MIND, SPIRIT, AND BODY NECESSARY FOR A REWARDING LIFE OF LEADERSHIP AND SERVICE IN A DIVERSE AND CHANGING WORLD
IRS990.Description: HIGHER EDUCATION: INSTRUCTION - INCLUDES 73 ACADEMIC MAJORS, FOREIGN STUDY PROGRAMS, HONORS PROGRAMS, AND OTHER EDUCATIONAL RELATED DEPARTMENTS SERVICING APPROXIMATELY 2,500 TOTAL STUDENTS AND STAFFED BY APPROXIMATELY 260 FACULTY MEMBERS. (2500 STUDENTS)

Activity2.Description: HIGHER EDUCATION: ACADEMIC SUPPORT - INCLUDES LIBRARY SUPPORT OF 195,000 TOTAL VOLUMES, AUDIOVISUAL MATERIALS AND EQUIPMENT, ART EXHIBITS, JAZZ, THEATER, BAND, CHOIR, DEBATE, INTERCOLLEGIATE ATHLETICS, AND RELATED ACTIVITIES SERVICING THE STUDENT AND THE COMMUNITY. (2500 STUDENTS)

Activity3.Description: HIGHER EDUCATION: AUXILIARY ENTERPRISES - SERVES THE STUDENT COMMUNITY BY SELLING TEXTBOOKS AND OTHER INSTRUCTIONAL MATERIALS AND SUPPLIES, AND PROVIDES MEAL SERVICE AND HOUSING. (2500 STUDENTS)

OtherAssets.Description: CASH SURRENDER VALUE OF LIFE INSURANCE

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Identifier: Collections of art - description of collections
Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Explanation: THE COLLEGE RECORDS THE ART COLLECTION IN OUR FINANCIAL STATEMENTS. THE ART COLLECTION CONSISTS OF WORKS OF ART, HISTORICAL TREASURES OR SIMILAR ASSETS THAT ARE HELD FOR PUBLIC EXHIBITION, EDUCATION OR RESEARCH.
THE ENDOWMENTS' PRIMARY PURPOSE IS TO PROVIDE SUPPORT TO BOTH AUGUSTANA COLLEGE'S GENERAL OPERATING BUDGET, TO STUDENT SCHOLARSHIPS AND AWARDS, AND TO SUPPORT FACULTY CHAIRS AND PROFESSORSHIPS.

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Identifier: Other revenues in audited financial statements not in form 990
Other expenses in form 990 not in audited financial statements

IRS990ScheduleE.PubViaBroadcastMediaExpln: ALL THE BROCHURES AND CATALOGS DEALING WITH STUDENT ADMISSIONS, PROGRAMS AND SCHOLARSHIPS, INCLUDE OUR RACIALLY NONDISCRIMINATORY POLICY AS TO THE STUDENTS. FURTHER, ALL WRITTEN ADVERTISING GIVEN TO PROSPECTIVE STUDENTS CONTAINS OUR POLICY STATEMENT. BECAUSE WE CUSTOMARILY DRAW ABOUT 90% OF OUR STUDENTS FROM OUTSIDE THE GENERAL COMMUNITY, WE DO NOT HAVE TO PUBLICIZE OUR NONDISCRIMINATORY POLICY TO THE GENERAL COMMUNITY. IN ORDER TO DEMONSTRATE THAT WE ARE FOLLOWING OUR POLICY, WE POINT TO OUR CURRENT FIRST YEAR ENROLLMENT OF RACIALLY MINORITY STUDENTS WHICH STANDS AT ABOUT 15%. WE FEEL THIS IS A MEANINGFUL NUMBER TO QUALIFY FOR THE PUBLICITY NOTICE EXCEPTION PROVIDED BY SECTION 4.03(2)(B) IF REV.PROC.75-50. _

Form990ScheduleIPartIV.Identifier: Procedures for monitoring use of grant funds
Form990ScheduleIPartIV.Explanation: THE INSTITUTION AWARDS BOTH NEED BASED AND MERIT BASED FUNDS AND ARE DISTRIBUTED IN A FAIR AND EQUITABLE BASIS. FUNDS ARE AWARDED BASED ON THE INSTITUTIONS PACKAGING POLICIES AND AWARDING CRITERIA. STUDENTS MUST COMPLETE THE FREE APPLICATION FOR FEDERAL STUDENT AID (FAFSA) ON A YEARLY BASIS TO APPLY FOR NEED BASED INSTITUTIONAL ASSISTANCE. THE FAFSA RESULTS ARE USED TO DETERMINE ELIGIBILITY FOR NEED BASED AWARDS BASED ON THE ESTABLISHED INSTITUTIONS PACKAGING POLICIES. SPECIAL CIRCUMSTANCES MAY BE CONSIDERED WHEN AWARDING NEED-BASED FUNDS AND ARE CONSIDERED ON AN INDIVIDUAL BASIS. STUDENT RECORDS/FILES ARE KEPT FOR 5 YEARS FROM THE DATE OF LAST ENROLLMENT---FILES WILL INCLUDE FAFSA'S AND ALL SUPPORTING DOCUMENTATION FOR DETERMINING ELIGIBILITY.

Form990ScheduleJPartIII.Identifier: Housing allowance or residence for personal use
Form990ScheduleJPartIII.Explanation: STEVEN BAHLS - TERMS OF EMPLYMENT CONTRACT STATES THAT AN ON CAMPUS HOME WILL BE PROVIDED AND HE IS REQUIRED TO RESIDE IN SAID HOME - NON TAXABLE

GeneralExplanation.Explanation: HIGHER EDUCATION: STUDENT SERVICES - SERVES THE STUDENT COMMUNITY BY PROVIDING REGISTRATION ASSISTANCE, COUNSELING, CAREER PLANNING, INTERNSHIPS, FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE, MULTICULTURAL PROGRAMMING, ORIENTATION AND ADVISING, INTRAMURAL SPORTS, AND OTHER RELATED PROGRAMS. (2500 STUDENTS) HIGHER EDUCATION: PUBLIC SERVICES - INCLUDES A CENTER FOR COMMUNICATIVE DISORDERS, ART PROGRAMS, ALUMNI PROGRAMS, COMMUNITY SERVICE AND A NATIONAL PUBLIC RADIO STATION SERVING THE STUDENTS AND COMMUNITY. (2500 STUDENTS) HIGHER EDUCATION: RESEARCH - SUPPORTS EXTENSIVE OPPORTUNITIES FOR STUDENTS AND FACULTY TO CONDUCT RESEARCH ON AND OFF CAMPUS. (2500 STUDENTS)

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, Line 2
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: SUNDER SUBBAROYAN - BUSINESS RELATIONSHIP; DOUG HULTQUIST - BUSINESS RELATIONSHIP;

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Review of form 990 by governing body
GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, Line 11A
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE FORM 990 IS PROVIDED TO THE FULL BOARD OF TRUSTEES FOR REVIEW AND COMMENT VIA A SECURE WEBSITE PRIOR TO FILING; THE AUDIT COMMITTEE OF THE BOARD APPROVES THE FORM 990 BEFORE FILING.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, Line 12c
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE COLLEGE ANNUALLY DISTRIBUTES THE CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY AND DISCLOSURE STATEMENT TO ALL OFFICERS, DIRECTORS, TRUSTEES AND KEY EMPLOYEES. RESPONSES ARE REVIEWED BY THE ATTORNEY COUNSEL AND AUDIT COMMITTEE

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Process used to establish compensation of top management official
GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, Line 15a
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE COMPENSATION COMMITTEE OF THE BOARD REVIEWS COMPENSATION FOR OFFICERS AND KEY EMPLOYEES ON AN ANNUAL BASIS AND INCORPORATES AVAILABLE COMPARABILITY DATA: SUCH PROCESS IS DOCUMENTED IN THE MINUTES OF COMPENSATION COMMITTEE.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Process used to establish compensation of other officers/key employees
GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, Line 15b
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THESE POSITIONS WERE LAST REVIEWED FOR SALARY YEAR ENDING AUGUST 31, 2010. COLLEGE PRESIDENT VICE PRESIDENT OF BUSINESS AND FINANCE VICE PRESIDENT OF ENROLLMENT COLLEGE CHAPLAIN VICE PRESIDENT AND DEAN OF STUDENT SERVICES VICE PRESIDENT OF ADVANCEMENT DEAN OF THE COLLEGE GENERAL COUNSEL

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, Line 19
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE GOVERNING DOCUMENTS, CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY, AND FINANCIAL STATEMENTS ARE AVAILABLE IN HARD COPY AND ELECTRONICALLY UPON REQUEST FROM THE PUBLIC.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Financial aid or assistance from a governmental agency
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE IS RECEIVED FROM THE STATE OF ILLINOIS AS FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE FOR NON-PUBLIC INSITUTIONS, AND FEDERALLY FUNDED STUDENT AID PROGRAMS INCLUDE COLLEGE WORK STUDY PROGRAM, STAFFORD LOAN PROGRAM, PELL GRANT PROGRAM, PERKINS LOAN PROGRAM, SUPPLEMENTAL EDUCATIONAL OPPORTUNITY GRANT PROGRAM, SMART GRANT PROGRAM, AND ACADEMIC GRANT PROGRAM.
